required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to improve outcome for kidney transplant recipients. There has not been commensurate improvement in medium and long-term outcomes. Ongoing clinical research is necessary to improve transplant outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is looking at information already collected of transplant outcomes (short, medium and long-term complications and quality of life). This will specifically look at:
1. 10 year follow-up of steroid-free maintenance immunosuppression
2. A cross-sectional study of infection after kidney transplantation (with emphasis on infection in steroid-free recipients
3. An evaluation of the Delayed Graft Function (DGF) nomogram in Thymoglobulin treated recipients at the University of Minnesota

primary_outcome.description: All studies are analyses from the Transplant Outcomes Database. Recipients have signed consent to have medical information entered into the database for these analyses. The database contains information on short, medium and long-term results.

arm_group.description: Kidney Transplant Recipients at the University of Minnesota since 1984. The study looks at a 10 year followup of steroid-free maintenance immunosuppression, post-transplant infections and evaluation of the DGF nomogram in Thymoglobulin on patients at the University of Minnesota.

intervention.description: 10 year follow-up of steroid-free maintenance immunosuppression
A cross-sectional study of infection after kidney transplantation (with emphasis on infection in steroid-free recipients).

intervention.intervention_name: Evaluation of the DGF nomogram in Thymoglobulin
intervention.description: An evaluation of the DGF nomogram in Thymoglobulin treated recipients at the University of Minnesota

study_pop.textblock: Kidney transplant recipients at the University of Minnesota

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Kidney Transplant Recipient at the University of Minnesota
- Kidney Transplant Recipients on steroid-free maintenance immunosuppression
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-kidney transplant patients at the University of Minnesota

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute
